name: Coordinates
description: Secure context This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers. The Coordinates interface represents the position and altitude of the device on Earth, as well as the accuracy with which these properties are calculated.

members.name: Coordinates.latitude
members.description: Returns a double representing the position's latitude in decimal degrees.

members.name: Coordinates.longitude
members.description: Returns a double representing the position's longitude in decimal degrees.

members.name: Coordinates.altitude
members.description: Returns a double representing the position's altitude in meters, relative to sea level. This value can be nullÂ if the implementation cannot provide the data.

members.name: Coordinates.accuracy
members.description: Returns a double representing the accuracy of the latitude and longitude properties, expressed in meters.

members.name: Coordinates.altitudeAccuracy
members.description: Returns a double representing the accuracy of the altitude expressed in meters. This value can be null.

members.name: Coordinates.heading
members.description: Returns a double representing the direction in which the device is traveling. This value, specified in degrees, indicates how far off from heading true north the device is. 0 degrees represents true north, and the direction is determined clockwise (which means that east is 90 degrees and west is 270 degrees). If speed is 0, heading is NaN. If the device is unable to provide heading information, this value is null.

members.name: Coordinates.speed
members.description: Returns a double representing the velocity of the device in meters per second. This value can be null.
